Package entities

Class Broker

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • entities.Broker

  • public class Broker
extends java.lang.Thread
    Implementation of a Broker, an essential character on a horse race action. This entity, belonging to the entities package, has the responsibility of controlling the races and of honouring and accepting the spectator's bets (for more information about the spectator, please, consult Spectator).
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Hugo Fragata, Rui Lopes
    See Also:
    Spectator, HorseJockey

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private BettingCentre bettingCentre
      The BettingCentre instance where this Broker will perform its actions.
      private ControlCentre controlCentre
      The ControlCentre instance where this Broker will perform its actions.
      private Stable stable
      The Stable instance where this Broker will perform its actions.
      private BrokerState state
      A representation of the Broker's state given by the BrokerState enumeration.
      private int totalOfRaces
      Broker's knowledge of how many races are about to be performed today.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run​()
        Definition of the Broker's lifecycle. In a technical perspective this is reasoned by a thread definition function which resumes all the specifications of a Broker, since its displacement from the BettingCentre, to the ControlCentre.
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • getBrokerState

        public BrokerState getBrokerState​()
        Returns the Broker state representation given by the BrokerState enumeration.
        Returns:
        the current broker BrokerState.
        See Also:
        BrokerState

      • setBrokerState

        public void setBrokerState​(BrokerState state)
        Sets the Broker's state, from the possible available BrokerState enumeration.
        Parameters:
